content: This is trivial (so I'd send a PR presumably if it's welcome), and does not affect functionality in any way, but I suspect the example in the Hello World widget manual is not precisely what was intended -- specifically I bet someone wanted to concatenate the string in JS, because right now it will show just the string world!" if you don't pass a name, and will show the string julian! very excitedly if you do, as opposed to Hello world! and Hello julian!.
(CC @David Thrane Christiansen I think? Though apologies if the ping isn't welcome.)
A ping is just fine! But I think @Wojciech Nawrocki owns that page of docs.
Ah yeah, that entire page is outdated. Let me update it.
